fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A single scheduled rule executes twice for some customers intermittently
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Difficult to reproduce.
 # Create a rule that executes once a day
 # Check the audit logs

h3. Expected Results

The rule executes once a day 
h3. Actual Results

The rule sometimes triggered twice on the same day at the same time with a difference of a 4-5 seconds
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: A single scheduled rule executes twice for some customers intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When adding fields as columns to be displayed for a filter, only 25 results are returned. In a situation where there are more than 25 results that match the string provided in the search, the desired result may not be returned.

h3. How to reproduce
 # Create multiple custom fields that contain the same word
 ** In the test performed, more than 25 custom fields had the word *Status* in their name
 # Open a filter in the *List view*
 # Click *Columns*
 # Search for the field you're looking to add

h3. Expected result
 * It would be expected that at least the field that matched *exactly* the string provided would be returned

h3. Actual result
 * Only 25 results are returned, but not necessarily the one you're expecting to see. Because there is no pagination, the desired result may not be reachable
  !Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 6.54.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 * In the example above, there were more than 25 custom fields named *<something> Status*. The field to be added was the system field *Status*, but because of this behavior, it was not possible to add it as a column, as it is not returned by the search.

h3. Workaround:
* Using [PUT - Add Filter Columns|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-filters/#api-rest-api-3-filter-id-columns-put] endpoint, it is possible to set the columns of a filter you own. 

Below, an example of how this request can be executed using *cURL*. In this example, the updated filter would have the columns *Issue Key, Summary, Assignee and Status* set
{code}
curl -D- -u <emailAddress>:<apiToken> -X PUT -d columns=issuekey -d columns=summary -d columns=assignee -d columns=status https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/filter/{filterId}/columns
{code}
 * For custom fields, specify its IDs in the format *customfield_\{id\}* (i.e. customfield_10000)
fields.summary: Only 25 results are returned when adding columns to filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Following the steps as mentioned [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/import-and-export-automation-rules/],if one migrated the Automation Rules from Server to Cloud and if the rule from Server is trying to copy attachments, then we will not be  able to publish this rule in Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Rule in Jira Server which is copying attachment as attached below:

 !Screenshot 2021-09-15 at 7.47.56 AM.png|thumbnail! 

2. Follow the steps mentioned [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/import-and-export-automation-rules/] and migrate the rules from Jira Server to Cloud.

3. The rule will get migrated but we will not be able to publish the rule.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to publish the Rule.

h3. Actual Results
Unable to publish the rule. In the dev panel we can see the following error:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-15 at 7.51.53 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The copying rule will not help so we need to create a new rule in Jira Cloud from scratch.
fields.summary: Unable to publish an Automation Rule which is migrated from Jira Server to Cloud and has "copy attachment" as an action in it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Entering a comment in the Add Flag and Comment dialog box is not translating Non-ASCII characters
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Right click an issue > select Add flag
 # Type a Non-ASCII, like ""(quotation marks) > click in Add
 !image-2021-09-14-18-02-21-269.png|width=339,height=138!
 # Click in the issue, the Non-ASCII character in the flag comment wasn’t translated
 !image-2021-09-14-18-05-21-647.png|width=108,height=82!

h3. Expected Results

If you type "" in add Flag, the result should be ""
h3. Actual Results

If you type "" in add Flag, the result is &quot ;&quot ;
h3. Workaround

Edit the flag after you add one if it presents any special character.
fields.summary: Non-ASCII characters are not translated when adding Flag through the board/backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 When you attach a image on the Description field, after the ticket is created, and add the Description column on Queues, the image shows under the column, but when you click it, it does not expand.

If you attach the image under Description field *during* ticket creation, and click on the image, it does expand.

In short: 
* When the image is attached *during* the ticket creation on the Description field, *it is clickable*
* When the image is attached *after* the ticket creation, on the Description field, *it is not clickable*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket
# Once the ticket is created, edit the Description by adding a image to it
# Once that's done, go to your queue, edit and add the column Description
# The queue will show the Description with the image just fine, but when you click on the image, it doesn't expand/open
# Customer has to open the ticket, and then click on the image to expand it.

The same does not happen when you attach the image on the Description field *during* the ticket creation

h3. Expected Results
* From the queue view, when clicking on the image that is under Description, it should open the image on a full view for better visualization

h3. Actual Results
* Image doesn't open, it displays on a thumbnail size, which makes hard to visualize


h3. Workaround
* Attaching the image on Description field during ticket creation
* Opening the ticket first, and then the image


 !image-2021-09-14-16-40-55-204.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-09-14-16-42-01-021.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-09-14-16-43-03-291.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attaching a image on Description after ticket is created doesn't open when clicking from Queues screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to open a web link which has a downloadable file attached to it, Chrome does not allow the download and rather close automatically. While, the same works well with firefox. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a link to a downloadable file hosted in a webpage to your Jira issue
 # Click on the weblink.
 # A new tab will open and the download option would not appear even though there are not restrictions and blockers. No handlers prohibiting the download.

h3. Expected Results

A popup appears prompting for a download.
h3. Actual Results

[^2021-09-14_20-27-01.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Weblink with downloadable file does not work in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Self-Transition doesnt show up for the subtasks
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a workflow that has a self-transition.
 * Create an issue and a subtask
 * Open the subtask in RapidView. 
 * Change the transition. It doesn't show the Self-Transition. 
 * Refresh the page. It does show the Self-Transition.

h3. Expected Results

Once the transition is made, the Self-Transition should be visible as well. 
h3. Actual Results

[^Screen Recording 2021-09-14 at 17.00.12.mov]
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page after selecting the transition which does show up the Self-Transition
fields.summary: Self-Transition doesnt show up for the subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Changes to Project Roles (e.g. name update)  can't be tracked.

Suggested Solution

Add changes on Project Roles to Audit logs
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Add changes on Project Roles to Audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tooltip of the issue summary of a board is not displayed properly when the window size of the browser is small or it's zoomed in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a kanban board
 # change browser zoom level to 150% or change the browser window size small
 # try to display the tooltip by mouseover

h3. Expected Results
The tooltip is displayed properly
*  !Screen Shot 2021-09-14 at 18.05.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The tooltip is not displayed properly
*  !Screen Shot 2021-09-14 at 18.05.03.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tooltip of the issue summary of a board is not displayed properly when the window size of the browser is small or it's zoomed in.

fields.description:
*Suggestion*

As of now, A4J does not support the way we can customise text using the Atlassian editor for Summary, Comment etc. Automation should enable fields to have richer content in the field values.

e.g the Status lozenge can’t be created using the Automation rule.
fields.summary: Rich editor for text fields in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue types are not translated on every screen/page and is very inconsistent while working with these (Create screen, Board, Issue view, Roadmap) etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language on your Account settings to anything other than English.
 # Issue types would be translated on Create screen but not on issue view or vice-versa.

h3. Expected Results

The issue types should be consistent on all the pages(create screen, Issue view, backlogs, Roadmap etc)
h3. Actual Results

The issue types are not translated on every screen/page and is very inconsistent while working with these (Create screen, Board, Issue view, Roadmap) etc.
h3. Workaround

In some cases, we can try using the "Translate" button against the Issue type and manually type in the translation.
fields.summary: Issue types translation is inconsistent on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Worklog is' operations will fire Slack notifications for all issue types, despite specific issue type being selected
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. On Project Settings > Slack Integration > Channel notification select a certain issue type
2. Define a few events, e.g 'Issue is', 'Comment is', 'Worklog is', etc

!image-2021-09-14-11-51-47-303.png|width=278,height=109!

3. Update the worklog of a story: Slack notification triggered, which is not intended as Story is not selected

4. All other operations apart from 'Worklog is' work as expected
h3. Expected Results

Jira to respect the issue type chosen for all events
h3. Actual Results

Jira is not respecting the issue type
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Slack Integration > Channel Notifications not respecting the issue type

fields.description: Notifications can easily become spam. To avoid this, it would be great if moving an issue to another sprint wasn't considered as an "Issue updated" event.
fields.summary: Don't notify sprint change on issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an issue contains a Date Picker on the issue description, and the issue is cloned, the date on the Cloned issue shows a grey formatted text instead of in 'Date Picker' format.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a date using the Date Picker on the issue description
 !image-2021-09-14-09-21-29-525.png|thumbnail! 
 # Clone the issue using the 'Clone' feature

h3. Expected Results
On the cloned issue, the added date should show in the 'Date Picker' format

h3. Actual Results

The date on the cloned issue shows a grey formatted text instead of in 'Date Picker' format
 !image-2021-09-14-09-23-31-872.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: '/Date' does not show as 'Datepicker' format on Cloned issues

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to mention teams that belong to users under the same domain even if not part of the instance. It would be great to have the possibility to disable it.
fields.summary: Option to disable mentioning teams outside of the instance

fields.description: It would be great to have a dashboard gadget in Jira to show story-points assigned to an individual per sprint.
fields.summary: Gadget for showing story-points assigned to an individual per sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom field of type 'People' (Select single user) in Team-managed Projects does not search for users in Basic search.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1: Create a Custom field of type 'People' in a Team-managed Project. Assign it to an issue type.

!Screenshot 2021-09-13 at 1.50.38 PM.png|width=675,height=338!
 Assuming there are issues created within this project and the newly created field has various users selected in it.
 Step 2: Search (Basic Search) for the Issues within the project, Add the filter for the 'People' field. Now search for the users within this field.
h3. Expected Results

Typing the user name should display the user's account in the suggestion.
h3. Actual Results

The Basic search does not display any suggestions for the users. However, when the search is switched to JQL, the users can be easily searched for and the issues that have these users in the 'People' field will be returned in results.
 * [^Screen Recording 2021-09-13 at 2.00.02 PM.mov]

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field of type 'People' (Select single user) in Team-managed Projects does not search for users in Basic search.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an odg file (LibreOffice file) is attached to an issue, the attachment might not be renderered correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an odg file from LibreOffice
 # Attach it to an issue
 # Click on the attachment to preview it

h3. Expected Results
The file preview is displayed
h3. Actual Results
The file preview shows as blank

h3. Workaround

Download the file to your machine and preview using LibreOffice app or other compatible tools.
fields.summary: Attaching an odg file to an issue may cause the attachment to not render

fields.description:
It would be great to have an icon or other indicator that visually shows a dependency between two issues or stories.

Example: If story1 is dependent on story2 (linked) we would see an arrow or other icon on the board that goes from story2 to story1.
fields.summary: Indicator or arrow to easily identify linked issues

fields.description:
h4. Use case scenario
A customer has a field that can only edit while transitioning the issue.
Automation cannot edit the field because the field is not available on the Issue Edit Screen.
The reason behind this is that customer doesn't want the field to be able to see and edit by users on the issue detail view.

h4. Expected behavior
Automation can edit any fields that are associated with the project regardless of Screen configuration.
OR
Be able to see the Transition Screen to edit the field.

h4. Actual result
Automation return "Unknown field set during the edit. They may be unavailable for the project/type.

h4. Workaround
Use the separate Screens for the Issue View and Edit actions. Then add the field only to the Edit screen.
fields.summary: Ability for Automation to edit any field on the project

fields.description: Ability to change the placement of issue created info from the bottom right to main issue screen
fields.summary: Ability to change the placement of issue created info

fields.description: For example, if a new feature is implemented and then a new system field is added, logs saying that the site admin added the field will be displayed in the audit log. These logs do not match the actual work that was done.
fields.summary: Work done in backend of the system should not be logged as work done by the site admin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
*.msg* files attached to an issue can't be previewed if the attachments are on 'List View'

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Upload a *.msg. file to an Issue in Jira
# Switch the 'Attachments' view to 'List View'
 !image-2021-09-10-11-19-35-968.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to click on the .msg attachment to preview

h3. Expected Results

The .msg file is able to be opened to preview

h3. Actual Results

The file will show as 'Can't be previewed'
 !image-2021-09-10-11-21-00-866.png|thumbnail! 

Interestingly, the preview works if the 'Attachments' view is switched to 'Strip View'
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-10 at 11.22.30.png|thumbnail!  
 
h3. Workaround

Switch the 'Attachments' view on the issue to 'Strip view'
fields.summary: MSG email files attachments preview is broken on List View

fields.description: It would be very helpful to allow the movement of the Issue Created and Issue Updated dates within the issue view. Since it's located at the very bottom of the fields list, each user is required to fully scroll to the bottom in order to see those fields.
fields.summary: Allow the "Issue Created/Updated" dates to be moved in the Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All issues filter doesn't display the new issues that are created
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select *All Issues* project filter
 # Create a *new* issue.
 # Unselect the *project* from the dropdown. The new issue will be shown.
 # Click the *All issues* filter again. The new issue doesn't show up.

h3. Expected Results

If a new issue is selected the All Issues filter results should get refreshed and show up the latest one. 
h3. Actual Results

Only the old issues are only shown as output. Below is a demo:
 !image-2021-09-09-20-00-30-501.png!
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page after selecting the *All Issues* filter displays all the issues including the new ones.
fields.summary: All issues filter doesn't display the new issues that are created in the same page

fields.description:
Allow the admins to delete the history of the logs from automation/other addons or store it in a separate log. so that it would not clutter the other actual updates made by the users. 

This would give a better view of the history.
fields.summary: Ability to delete the history of the addon logs

fields.description:
+_*Summary:*_+

In a Team-Managed project, the fields such as Issue Type and Labels are displayed as Dropdowns in the sprint board as shown below:

!Screenshot 2021-09-08 at 8.26.03 PM-1.png|thumbnail!

The sprint board is designed differently for Company-Managed projects which allows quick filters but not field dropdowns like Team managed projects:

!Screenshot 2021-09-09 at 11.49.35.png|thumbnail!
  

+_*Suggestion:*_+

As a Jira user, it would be good to have the look and feel of the Company-Managed project sprint board as same as the Team-managed Sprint board for the fields. A dropdown option for the fields is user-friendly and will have the visibility of all the available values to select.

 

_+*Workaround:*+_

The workaround is to use Quick filters:

!Screen Recording 2021-09-08 at 02.11.16 PM.gif!
fields.summary: Ability to have dropdown fields like Labels & Issue type displayed in a Company-Managed Sprint board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing issues from a sprint, some issues may end up missing a change history item.

This results in incorrect sprint status reports, where the issues appear to still be in the sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove issue from a sprint in the backlog screen

h3. Expected Results
Issue has a change item recording sprint: Sprint Name -> none

h3. Actual Results
Issue has no change item related to the sprint

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When removing an issue from a sprint, the change history may fail to update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new add gadget panel shows the gadget thumbnail in 1:1 aspect ratio, which is different from the 2:1 ratio in the old add gadget modal. As a result,  thumbnail images are cropped as squares with a full height but a reduced width. As a result all thumbnails look broken. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira dashboard 
 # Click on add gadget 

h3. Expected Results

Expect to see uncropped thumbnail 
h3. Actual Results

Thumbnails are cropped and incomplete 
h3. Workaround

No workaround required, the visual bug will be fixed by 9th Sep
fields.summary: Resize gadget thumbnail image in add gadget panel based on customer feedback

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having the resolution field without a default value (global setting) available in an issue creation screen makes it a required field preventing issue creation.
 This happens even though the resolution field is not required by default.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure there's no default resolution value
 # Add the resolution field to the create screen
 # Try to create an issue

h3. Expected Results

Resolution field should not be required and issue created.
h3. Actual Results

A resolution field is required and the issue is not created.
 Error message:
{code:java}
"The selected resolution is invalid."{code}
h3. Workaround
 * *OPTION 1*
 If you do need a resolution set during issue creation, set a default value for resolutions.

 * *OPTION 2*
 Make sure resolution is not included in the issue creation screen.
 If you only have a single screen for all the operations (create, view, edit), it's a best practice to create a different one for the create operation, making sure the resolution field is not present.

 

For more details, please check this document on [resolution field best practices|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/best-practices-on-using-the-resolution-field-968660796.html].
fields.summary: Resolution field without default value breaks issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sensitive data, like API keys, is visible to other users in the Jira Automation tool.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the ability to hide sensitive data from other Atlassian users.
h3. Why this is important

The Jira Automation tool allows for integrations with other services, however this is practically hampered for security reasons if other users who should not have access to those services can view things like API keys in the Jira Automation tool.

h3. Workaround

It is not currently possible to hide sensitive data in the Jira Automation tool. Consider removing the ability for Atlassian users to view the Jira Automation tool.
fields.summary: Hide Sensitive Data in the Jira Automation tool

fields.description:
Hi All,

I am using Windows Powershell to connect to Jira Cloud Rest Api to get the Backlog issues.

I am unable to export the JSON Data to csv.

 

Here is the PowerShell Scrip 

===========================================================

$headers = @{
 'Authorization' = 'Basic dmVua2ON20xWTE0czhFQUM='
 'Accept' = 'application/json'
}

$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Headers $headers -Uri "https://downer.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/145/backlog?maxResults=200" -Method Get

$backlog = $response.value
$backlog | Export-Csv -Path "C:\Users.csv" -NoTypeInformation

===========================================================

 

Error Message: 

 

Export-Csv : Cannot bind argument to parameter 'InputObject' because it is null.
At line:9 char:10
+ $users | Export-Csv -Path "C:\Users\venkata.talatam\Desktop\School\Us ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 + CategoryInfo : InvalidData: (:) [Export-Csv], ParameterBindingValidationException
 + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ParameterArgumentValidationErrorNullNotAllowed,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ExportCsvCommand

 

 

When i use Talend API and use the same it is working 

 

curl -i -X GET \
 -H "Authorization:Basic dmVua2ON20xWTE0czhFQUM=" \
 -H "Accept:application/json" \
 '[https://downer.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/145/backlog?maxResults=200'|https://downer.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/145/backlog?maxResults=200%27]

I get the JSON Format and can download it.

 

Request your expert help.

 

Regards,

Venkat
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud REST API POWERSHELL Export to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, date time is currently rounded down to the nearest minute when setting a timestamp field through REST/API.
h3. Expected results

The exact time should be considered and set as value in the issue.
h3. Actual results

Minutes are being rounded and both the seconds and milliseconds values have been set to zero.
fields.summary: Timestamp field value should not be rounded when being set through REST/API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team-managed custom fields are being displayed inside *Company-managed* projects when viewing the project settings. However, they are never available to be added to the issue view because they belong to a *Team-managed* project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field inside a Team-Managed project
 # On a *Company managed* project, go to *Project Settings > Fields*
 # The TM project field will be displayed

h3. Expected Results

As team-managed custom fields cannot be made available for use within a *Company-managed* project, they shouldn't be displayed in a CM project.
h3. Actual Results

The field is displayed but cannot be used in a screen.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team-managed custom fields are being displayed inside Company-managed field settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Showing Subtask count on the Card layout for Software Boards. Currently this feature is available in JWM Board.  {quote}  !Screenshot 2021-09-08 at 7.01.28 PM.png|thumbnail! {quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a software board and add Subtasks to the card layout.
 # This would show only the issue keys of the subtasks instead of the count.

h3. Expected Results

Would like to see the count of subtasks on the Card layout of an issue.
h3. Actual Results

Shows the issue keys of the subtasks on the card layout.
h3. Workaround
 # *Showing the subtask issue key's on the Card layout* - You could edit the board settings and navigate to "Card layout" to be able to add "Subtasks" on the cards in the backlog or the Active sprint board.

 # *Sort using stories to list out all the subtasks* - You could configure the swimlanes of the software Scrum board to be set to "*Stories*" and this would allow you to see the showcase the parent ticket and the subtasks below it.
fields.summary: Show Subtask count on the Card layout for Software Boards

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*

The agents can add public comments on the sub tasks which makes. Due to this, the customers receive the notification but cannot add a comment to it as it is not visible on the portal.

*Expected behavior:*

It would be great if the 'Reply to Customer' option can be removed for agents on the sub-tasks in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the 'Reply to Customer' option for agents on Sub Tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem
when using the edit option for an issue under the dashboard, the interface is spinning and not loading at all.

h3. Environment
JS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open Your instance
Click on Dashboards on the top
Select any dashboard which has a gadget and with an issue displayed.
click on the ... dots to the right of the issue and then select edit
It does not take you to a screen, but simply loads ( spinning )


h3. Expected Results
It should open the issue for editing

h3. Actual Results
Does not allow to edit the issue from the gadget ( dashboard) and then simply spins

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Edit function on an issue from the dashboard for any gadgets does not work

fields.description: In team-managed projects, you can see a pop-up window that only shows the required fields that need to be filled in. I'd like to use this feature in company managed projects as well.
fields.summary: Display pop-up window with missing fields required by workflow validator in company managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to replace priority field with custom field
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide functionality to replace priority field with custom field
fields.summary: Unable to replace Priority field with custom field

fields.description: Moving the 'Delete' option to the bottom of the context menu in Jira and keeping that consistent across the product would help eliminate confusion and accidental deletion of issues.
fields.summary: Move 'Delete' button to the bottom of the Context menu in Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you change the issue type from a task to a subtask Jira asks to select the new parent, if you select as a parent the issue that was its Epic parent nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic with a child issue
 # Change the Epic issue type to another like task or story 
 # Change the child issue type to subtask selecting as the parent the issue that was the Epic
[Video Example:|https://share.getcloudapp.com/z8ur1Dez]

h3. Expected Results
The parent from the newly changed sub-task should be the one selected

h3. Actual Results
The subtask is shown without a parent

h3. Workaround

Do a bulk move operation to update again the parent issue
fields.summary: Changing issue type to subtask does not put the selected parent if the issues had an Epic > task relationship

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding/updating the Original estimate using an automation rule doesn't update the remaining estimate. The remaining estimate is set to 0h.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule to add the Original estimate upon issue creation
# Create issue
# Notice the Original and Remaining estimate values, check the issue history.

h3. Expected Results
The remaining estimate should be set based on the value provided for the Original Estimate.


h3. Actual Results
The remaining estimate value is set to 0H.
 !Original estimate added through automation rule.png|thumbnail! 
 !Original estimate added manually.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Add an action to update the Remaining estimate.
fields.summary: Adding/updating the Original estimate using an automation rule doesn't update the remaining estimate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Creating an Issue in JIRA using REST API endpoint “rest/api/3/issue” and if the user has a post function in the Create Issue Workflow to Copy the Text/data from *Multine-Line CustomField* to the Default *Description* Field, the post function doesn’t work/execute.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multiline CustomField.
 # Update the Project workflow such that the “Create Issue” Transition has a Post-Function which copies data from one field to another. In this example from the *MultiLine CustomField* to *Description* Field.
!Screenshot 2021-08-04 at 1.43.26 AM.png|thumbnail!!Screenshot 2021-08-04 at 1.43.39 AM.png|thumbnail!
 # Using the REST API endpoint “rest/api/3/issue” create a JIRA issue.
 # Pass the Value/Text content in the *MultiLine CustomField* in the payload. This content is expected to be copied over to the *Description* Field.

h3. Expected Results
 * The Issue gets Created and the Post-Function is triggered with the data in the *MultiLine CustomField* copied to *Description* Field.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Issue is Created, but the Post-Function doesn’t execute.

h3. Workaround

The Post-Function works as expected when the REST API endpoint is “rest/api/2/issue”
fields.summary: When Creating an Issue using the REST API endpoint “rest/api/3/issue”, Post function to Copy field data is ignored

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since by default Jira Automation executes rules using the Automation for Jira user, and the user has permissions on all the projects, some actions could not be restricted to who is creating the rule.

For example, the lookup issues action could show information that is not allowed to see since the JQL query is executed with the Automation for Jira user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # perform a lookup issues action witha JQL that should not show information to the creator of the rule
 # Send the returned issues' info by email

h3. Actual Results

Info is sent by email to the user that has no permission to see the issues
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mention in the Jira Automation documentation how exactly permissions work (lookup issues)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

As of today, the Convert to Issue/Sub Task operation cannot be restricted to user, groups, issue types.
h3. Suggested Solution:

It could be possible to restrict it by:
 # *Groups*, i.e. only specific uses to be able to run this operation using project permission scheme
 # *Issue Types*, i.e. we would like to restrict the conversion to specific issue types.
For example:
 ## Block Bugs to be converted to Sub-task, etc.
fields.summary: Control permissions over convert subtask to issue (or vice versa)

fields.description:
h3.  
 * Jira issue numbers are not strictly increasing, sequential issue numbers
 * In certain scenarios it is possible for issue create to fail and consume an issue number, so the next successfully created issue may have a number that is not sequential with the last created issue eg ISSUE-1234 and ISSUE-1236
 * This feature suggestion is to change this behaviour so that issue numbers are guaranteed to start at 1, strictly be sequential and as such predictable.
fields.summary: Jira issue creation should not increment the counter key if issue creation fails

fields.description:
Unlike the Legacy rules, Automation for Jira doesn't  have the "Comment is primary action" validator, which makes it impossible to workaround the following bug:

- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4348
fields.summary: Add the "Comment is primary action" validator to Automation Rules

fields.description:
*Jira Issue Calendar gadget* currently does not allow you to select *Resolved date* under *Date to Display* dropdown.
h3. Suggestion: 

Include *Resolved date* under *Date to Display* dropdown. 

!Screenshot 2021-09-06 at 3.54.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the ability to choose Resolved date in Jira Issues Calendar under date to display

fields.description:
*Use case*: 
* have an Epic with child issues 
* under a comment add one of the child issues

*Current behaviour*: 
middle click on the child issue under "Issues in this epic" → it opens up on a new tab and focus automatically goes to that child issue
middle click on the child issue under the comment → it opens on a new tab in the background. Focus is remains on the epic/current issue that I am on

*Request*: 
Have a consistent approach to middle click of linked issues. Ideally, user should not be moved away from the current work they’re doing so open the link in a new tab by default, but in the background
fields.summary: Consistent behaviour for middle click on linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New users isn't created when email sent from non-existing user using the "create user" option checkbox within the mail handler configuration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to JIRA > JIRA Settings > System > Incoming Mail or "GG" Incoming Mail
 # Click "Add incoming mail handler" button to create new mail handler.
 # Click Next
 # Select "Create a new issue or add acomment"
 # Tick "Create Users" checkbox
 # Click Add

h3. Expected Results

Create new JIRA user and issue using the user's email as a username, subject and content.
h3. Actual Results

User and issue isn't created
h3. Workaround

To allow Jira to handle email messages sent from people without a Jira user account:
 # Create an anonymous or dummy mail account on your mail server.
 # Create an equivalent anonymous or dummy Jira user account, whose email address matches the mail account you just created.
 # When configuring your mail handler options, set the Default Reporter to be the anonymous or dummy Jira user account.
fields.summary: Mail Handler isn't creating new user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to load the "Rule executions" section on Jira Native mobile app results in a blank page. This issue is occurring on certain sites only and impacts all native platforms: *Android*, *iOS* and *macOS* apps.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira issue on iOS/Android phone on Jira mobile app
 # Open section "Rule executions"

h3. Expected Results

The section loads fine
h3. Actual Results

The section loads a blank(empty) page
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

(i) The only workaround available at this point is to load "Rule executions" on a computer browser.
fields.summary: As a user on Jira mobile app, opening "Rule executions" on an issue results into blank page

fields.description:
When the link converts to a smart link, it’s usually the title of the linked resource that will be displayed. If the title of the linked resource contains a line break, the smart link actually renders a line break, which doesn't look very nice.

It would be nice if the smart link could disregard or treat such characters to render properly.
fields.summary: Smart links should remove non-printable characters from its render

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Webhook events are lost if there are a large number of Webhooks registered in the cloud instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have about ~2000 webhooks created in the Jira cloud instance
 # Create a webhook and configure it to trigger for "Issue updated" events
 # Make an update in the Jira issue to trigger the webhook

h3. Expected Results
Webhook event is successfully triggered and sent out to the destination site 
or 
Enforce a limit of Webhooks that can be created in the cloud instance.

h3. Actual Results
Webhook events are triggered, however, the events do not reach the destination site.

h3. Workaround
Reduce the number of webhooks created in the cloud instance.
fields.summary: Webhook events are lost if there are a large number of Webhooks registered in the cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem
It will be user friendly, if we can get a pop up to come up when using the API calls which require a token, when using a browser.
it feels inconvenient to use CURL or POSTMAN to perform this function.

h3. Suggested Solution
A pop up which provides a box to provide the access token

h3. Why This Is Important
Convenient for the customer

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Need a popup to provide the access token when using a browser request through API

fields.description:
Allow the user to customize what fields they want to show for sub-tasks list within a main issue. Example in screenshot below is from a Story with sub-tasks. I would for instance like to easily get an overview of the estimate of a sub-task from this view without having to click it. 

!image-2021-09-03-10-04-31-432.png!
fields.summary: Option to have customized sub-tasks list

fields.description:
When an issue is moved between projects, the original issue key is left unassigned, it is never reused, and exists solely as a searchable item pointing to the new issue key.
If the issue is subsequently moved back to the original project it is then assigned a new issue key in the project.
It would make more sense if the original issue key was reassigned to the issue.
 * Recently we needed to 'undo' an incorrect move, and users subsequently queried why the number had changed.
 * Documents that are not on the Jira network need to be updated every time an issue is being moved. Why not save the update when it is not needed?
fields.summary: Moving an issue back to a previous project SHOULD re-use the 'old' issue key

fields.description:
*Summary*: 
There is no easy way to identify the usage of custom fields across filters/boards/dashboards

*Suggestion*: 
Have a way to identify/admin custom field utilisation across filters/boards//dashboards

This can help when there is a need to migrate/utilise a new custom or system field instead of an old custom field
fields.summary: Identify/admin usage of custom fields across filters, boards and dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
HTML and CSV export (all fields) doesn't follow the field order that is displayed in the UI.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make HTML and CSV export follow the order of fields visible in the UI, and concatenate the rest of the fields that are not visible in the UI.

h3. Workaround
Configure the UI and use HTML and CSV export (current fields).
fields.summary: Add ability of HTML and CSV export (all fields) to be in the order that is displayed in UI

fields.description:
On the https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa , we have
||Name||Username||Host Name||Authentication Type||Actions||
|Default Cloud Mail Server|jira@<instance>.atlassian.net|-|-|-|

This default option currently has no customization available.
 Would be interesting to have the option to change the username from "jira@..." to something else.
fields.summary: Option to customize the Default Cloud Mail Server - Username on Incoming Mail for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to clear the value of date time picker fields is by clicking on the field value, clicking on the "X" that appears on the right-hand side, then clicking on the field area again and clicking outside de field area. 

Here's a short video showing how it works: https://share.getcloudapp.com/eDuRg0Ed

h3. Problem
If you don't click inside the field area after clicking on the "X", the change will not be saved.

h3. Suggestion
Improve this experience in a way that clicking on the "X" clears the value and saves the change.
fields.summary: Improve the experience of clearing date time picker field value

fields.description:
Currently, a fields added to the "Description" section of the agent view will always be displayed.

Empty fields could be hidden on the right column until a value is added to them, similar to the "Hide when empty" section fields.

Except that, if they have a value, they're displayed in the center column, below the request form fields instead of the right column.
fields.summary: Request Type "Description" fields should act as "Hide when Empty"

fields.description:
Currently, the field Estimation Statistics in boards only allow Number Field as a default. 

There are users that want to limit the options when choosing Story points for a task, so allowing them to choose a Select List as their Estimation Statistics would facilitate this type of control over the stories.
fields.summary: Allow Select List as Estimation Statistics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to copy a value from a drop down custom field to "Security Level" field using "Copy Value From Other Field" post function in "Create" issue transition , it is not working. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single list custom field , and set "Jira" as an option
 # In the project , create security level called "Jira" too.
# In workflow "Create" transition , add "Copy Value From Other Field" post function. Use the custom field as the source field and Security Level as destination field.
# Publish the workflow.

h3. Expected Results
Able to copied the value.

h3. Actual Results
Not working.

h3. Workaround
Use automation to update the Security Level field after issue created.
fields.summary: "Copy Value From Other Field" post function not working for "Security Level" field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User Query Language is documented as accepting capitalized boolean operators, but such queries fail with the error "Unable to parse UQL".

The example query in the reference documentation at [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-user-search/#api-rest-api-3-user-search-query-get] is as follows: 
{noformat}
is assignee of PROJ AND [propertyKey].entity.property.path is "property value"
{noformat}
This issue has been raised in response to https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/search-users-by-query-docs-are-wrong/51569.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a browser, log into a Jira tenant such as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net.
 # Invoke the Jira API with a UQL search including an uppercase boolean operator such as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search/query?query=is%20assignee%20of%20ACJIRA%20OR%20is%20assignee%20of%20ACJIRA

h3. Expected Results

User search results are returned.
h3. Actual Results

The following error response is returned:
{noformat}
Unable to parse UQL
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Change the boolean operator to lower case. e.g. https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search/query?query=is%20assignee%20of%20ACJIRA%20or%20is%20assignee%20of%20ACJIRA
fields.summary: UQL does not accept capitalized boolean operators

fields.description: Currently, the *Insight Objects* are not compatible with the Jira app, hence it is necessary to work on the Web version to edit those fields specially during transitions.
fields.summary: Add the ability to see and fill Insight Object fields on Jira app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Can't link to Confluence page with a greater-than char in the title

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (or edit an existing page) in Confluence so that the title of the page includes the greater-than '>' symbol. Publish the page.
 # Go to a Jira issue, and use "Link confluence page", and specify that page

Reproducing the issue: https://share.getcloudapp.com/yAuy0mPN

h3. Expected Results
The link should be added to the ticket.

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed: *We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again.*

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't link to Confluence page with a greater-than char in the title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to remove code snippet via panel under comment or description
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*[Click here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuN9kDL]* to access the video with the steps.
 # Open an issue
 # Add a "code snipped"
 # Select the code snippet recently added
 # Click on code snippet again via panel

h3. Expected Results

When clicking second time on code snippet with a code selected it should remove the code snipped instead of add another code snipped.
h3. Actual Results

Under comment or description, when we try to remove the code snippet via panel it will add another line instead of remove it.
h3. Workaround

Remove it manually.
fields.summary: Ability to remove code snippet via panel under comment or description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

if the attachments are set to 'List View', if you try to open a JSON attachment the browser will give you an error.
Happening in all browsers


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a JSON file to an issue
 # change the attachments to 'List View'
 # Try to open the attachment

h3. Expected Results

The JSON should be displayed as normal:
 
 !image-2021-09-01-16-53-00-143.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

Error:
 
 !image-2021-09-01-16-51-29-756.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use 'Strip View' if you have JSON attachments
fields.summary: JSON attachment causes the browser to give an error if accessed via 'List View' within an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is an issue that contains the word [BE] on the summary, we cannot find this issue using this JQL: project = X and text ~ "BE"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with [BE] on the summay
 # Open the advanced search
 # Enter project = X and text ~ "BE" and click on search.

h3. Expected Results
The issue created should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is returned.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: [BE] included on issue summary break its JQL token

fields.description:
h4. Situation

Issue Types in Basic Search in the Issue Navigator can only be found by the translation of the language pack used by the current user. The same status in the Advanced search (or JQL), can only be found by the original value.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Set the default system language of JIRA to English. (General Configuration)
 # Set the User language of JIRA to Polish (Polski)
 # Create an Issue Type "Task" or "BUG". Which when done by a user whose language setting is set to "Polski" in the account settings page, you will see "Zadanie" for Task and "Błąd w programie" for BUG.
 # Create issues with Issue Type "Zadanie" or "Błąd w programie"

h4. Expected result

When searching for issues through the Advanced Search in the issue navigator (or other searches using JQL) for Issue Type  "Zadanie" or "Błąd w programie", the previously generated issues will be found.
 !IssueTypeNameUsedInJira.png|thumbnail! 
 !JQL_Task_works.png|thumbnail! 
 !JQL_Zadanie_not_working.png|thumbnail!
h4. Actual result

No issues can be found in Issue Type "Zadanie" or "Błąd w programie". However, issues can be found when specifying Issue Types "Task" or "BUG"
fields.summary: JQL can not use translated values for Issue Types in JIRA

fields.description:
Currently the {{{{rule}}}} smart value provides {{{{rule.name}}}} and {{{{rule.actor}}}}.

It would be useful to also include the rule URL, or the rule ID (from which a URL can be created).
fields.summary: Expose rule URL / ID from smart values In Automation for Jira

fields.description:
Hi

 

Can we centrally run a calendar for national holidays, so these don't have to be manually entered in every individual SLA calendar?
fields.summary: Global National Holiday Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Canceling the file upload before completion causes the issue creation to be stuck

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue
# In the *Create issue* modal, upload an attachment and cancel it before the completion

h3. Expected Results
As the upload was canceled, the issue is created without problems.

h3. Actual Results
The issue cannot be created, as you get the error message *Upload in progress, please wait.* 

Note: As this error message won't go away, it's necessary to cancel the issue creation and start over.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Canceling the file upload before completion causes the issue creation to be stuck

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot complete a sprint in a next-gen project if an issue added to a sprint is converted from Task to Subtask.

Changing the type of an issue from task to subtask is not clearing the sprint value of the subtask. If the issue is a task and it's added to a sprint, the sprint value still remains in the Jira database after converting the type to subtasks, but it isn't visible in the UI. The only way to identify this is by searching issues associated with the affected sprint

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project
 # Add issues to the project created
 # Start the sprint
 # Create another sprint and add issues to that sprint
 # Start that sprint
 # Convert one of the issues under this sprint to the sub-task issue type in the other sprint
 # Try to complete the sprint created in step 3.

h3. Expected Results

The sprint gets completed.
h3. Actual Results

The UI throws the error:

"Something's gone wrong
 Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on the following issues: XX-123"

h4. Update: 
* There are some cases where Sprints also fail to be completed silently, Jira redirects to the backlog without completing the Sprint.
* There are also some scenarios where the associated Sprint is from a company-managed board causing the same behavior

h3. Workaround

Contact the support team to adjust the broken reference
 # Click on complete sprint to open the complete sprint modal in the project which has the issue  !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 3.08.00 PM.png|width=909,height=285!
 # Open the network tab in the console
 ## Link on how to do it - [https://support.happyfox.com/kb/article/882-accessing-the-browser-console-and-network-logs/]
 ## For chrome F12 -> click on Network
 # Click complete the sprint from the modal
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 3.40.21 PM.png!
 # Look for a network request titled graphql look for one of these which has an error similar to the following "Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks on following issues: BT-2"
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 3.42.46 PM.png|width=790,height=409!
 # Following this search this issue using the search bar open the issue and there should be subtasks under this issue (in my screenshot above "BT-2)
!Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 3.45.10 PM.png|width=811,height=268!
 # Move the subtasks to your done status
!Screen Shot 2021-09-02 at 3.49.19 PM.png!
 # You should be able to complete the sprint now
 # You can move the subtask statuses back to their original status
fields.summary: Cannot complete a sprint in a next-gen project if an issue added to a sprint is converted from Task to Subtask.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While deleting a next-gen project, the board related to that project is not always deleted with it. This problem is intermittent but the board cannot be deleted from the UI.

h3. Environment

Jira Software Next-Gen projects.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Delete a next-gen project.

h3. Expected results

All project dependencies should be deleted along with the project.

h3. Actual result

The board related to the project still showing on the board page and cannot be deleted.

h3. Workaround

Create a support ticket at [http://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: Boards not always deleting with project deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments are not showing correctly in Strip view when the screen size does not fit exactly the pictures making the carousel show pictures cut in half

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add multiple attachments
 # Navigate through the pictures with a zoomed view
 # You will see that the pictures that don't fit exactly the screen are shown cut and skipped when you change the carousel block
[Video Example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuNN0oj]

h3. Expected Results
Attachments that are cut should be included in the next carousel block

h3. Actual Results
Images are cut in half and when changing the carousel block it is easy to miss them

h3. Workaround
There are no workarounds to see image carousel in a fit view but you can change to list view to see all files
fields.summary: Attachments are not showing correctly in Strip view when the screen size does not fit exactly the pictures
Melhoria de funcionalidade

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes there will be cases where users will only want to show a transition if two fields have the same value (or not).

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new *Condition* to compare if two fields have the same value or not.
fields.summary: Add condition to compare two fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Original estimate field value is not cleared via Automation for Jira when using the Edit issue action component
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a Jira issue
 2) Populate Original estimate field value (Example: 2h)
 3) Create an automation rule as follows:
 _+Trigger+_: Manually Triggered
 _+Action+_: Edit Issue > Original Estimate (Leave the field value blank to clear the field)
h3. Expected Results

The Original estimate field value is cleared when the rule executes successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Automation for Jira shows successful rule execution, however, the original estimate field value is not cleared
h3. Workaround

In the Edit issue action component, set the Original Estimate field value to 0h instead.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Original estimate field value is not cleared when using Edit issue action component

fields.description: On open source projects, it is rather uncommon and even discouraged to put references to internal tools in PR titles or branch names that developers interact with. It would be great if the integration would scan the GitHub PR body (description) for the Jira issue slug.
fields.summary: Use GitHub PR Body to Link Jira Issue

fields.description:
Cloned from: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-77287

h3. Issue Summary

We've noticed that this endpoint in Jira are running on outdated versions of Jira cloud
 # /plugins/servlet/upm

Page 26 - 28 in attachment for the report
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit <jira_instance>/<path written above>

h3. Expected Results

Jquery version should be 3.6.0 (latest stable jquery release)

h3. Actual Results

Outdated version of jquery - 1.8.3 and 1.7.2
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Update jquery version in jira cloud for UPM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a transition that has a validator, as well as a post function, and then try to transition the issue without filling a required field (based on the validator), the post function will not execute even if you transition after filling in the required field(s).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a post function on a transition that will copy the value from the *Assignee* field to another user picker field
  !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 11.20.26.png|thumbnail! 
* Create a *Field required* validator, using the field *Comment* as the criteria
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 11.37.34.png|thumbnail! 
* Associate a screen that contains the field *Assignee* with the transition
* Try executing the transition, changing the value of the *Assignee* field but not adding a Comment
* Once the warning is displayed, add a comment and then execute the transition

h3. Expected Results

The transition will execute, and the post function will copy the value of the field *Assignee* to the custom field according to the post function's settings.

h3. Actual Results

The transition is executed, but the post function does not work.

h3. Workaround

The only ways to prevent such scenario are to:
* Avoid having such scenario on a transition (field required validator + copy value from other field post function)
* Or make sure to select the new value of the field, and also fill the required fields before transitioning
fields.summary: Field required validator failure prevents post function from working

fields.description:
Currently, the "Give Feedback" option is enabled by default and there is no way to control this option.

Jira adminstrators would like to control this feature by having an option to enable/disable the feedback option.
fields.summary: Option to disable the "Give Feedback" option for users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Edit action on the (...) dropdown on a "Filter Results" gadget gets stuck on loading.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a dashboard with _Filter Results_ gadget.
 # For any issue, click the (...) menu.
 # Select Edit.

h3. Expected Results

Selected issue loads to be edited.
h3. Actual Results

Dashboards fades, and load icon keeps rolling indefinetely.
h3. Workaround

Open the issue and edit, instead of selecting the Edit option.
fields.summary: Using the Edit action on the (...) dropdown on a "Filter Results" gadget gets stuck on loading.

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

In company-managed projects, end users would like to know the story points sum in the backlog while the sprint is running.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Add the story point sum for the backlog same as currently for the active sprint.
h3. Why is this important:

To have more insight into the work remaining in the backlog.
h3. Workaround:

Manual sum up of the story point in the backlog issues.

!Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 12.25.55.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Story points sum for Backlog

fields.description:
In the Jira cloud when I paste screenshot onto an issue, I will see an attach screenshot dialog to enter a file name for the pasted image. This feature is not avaiable in cloud.
h2. Expected:

You can capture a screenshot and drop or paste it directly onto an issue.
 # Capture a screenshot
 # Drop or paste the image onto the issue
 # Enter a file name
 # Select *Upload*
fields.summary: Attach screenshot dialog disappear

fields.description: As an admin, the ability to share custom field options with other fields is very useful. For example, if you set a department name as an option and share it with multiple fields, you will not need to change the options of all fields after the reorganization.
fields.summary: Ability to share custom field options with other fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Activity Stream Gadget does not reflect Confluence Activity consistently

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up same site Confluence Activity Stream by allowing anonymous access https://<site>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/permissions/global?tab=anonymous
# Under Activity Stream gadget > Configure, Confluence will be visible with the option to set a Filter 
!image-2021-08-30-11-24-24-272.png|thumbnail! 
# Apply changes on Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Confluence changes should reflect on the Activity Stream gadget

h3. Actual Results
Confluence changes appear intermittently. Activity Stream should consistently reflect Confluence changes

More tests showed the following behaviour:
* we could see that when setting the configuration to "Limit to 10 items", the gadget will show Jira related streams, clicking "Show More" will show Confluence related streams but not always in full.
* other times for the same configuration "Show More" will not show any Confluence streams
* When changing configuration to show more than 10 items, for example 50, it will not show Confluence at all

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity Stream Gadget does not reflect Confluence Activity consistently

fields.description:
Part of this ticket was split into this one: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-77296

h3. Issue Summary

We've noticed that this endpoint in Jira are running on outdated versions of Jira cloud
 # /static-assets/metal-all.js 

Page 26 - 28 in attachment for the report
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit <jira_instance>/<path written above>

h3. Expected Results

Jquery version should be 3.6.0 (latest stable jquery release)
h3. Actual Results

Outdated version of jquery - 1.8.3 and 1.7.2
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Update jquery version in jira cloud

fields.description:
h3.  Issue Detail

Users are unable to personally subscribe to filters without global permission. 

h3. Steps to reproduce 
* Search for the filter
* Click on the _details_ and try to add a subscription
 !Permission deined.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected result

Users should be able to subscribe to the filter.

h3. Workaround 
Users need to be added in the global permission mentioned on [this page|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/work-with-search-results/#Workingwithsearchresults-Email] for now to be able to subscribe to the filters.
fields.summary: Personal filter subscription without the Manage group filter subscriptions global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*User email Visibility* in the *General configuration* is kind of obsolete since the *GDPR* introduction.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to General configuration
 # Set User email visibility to Public

h3. Expected Results

This setting should be removed from the General configuration and the documentation get updated accordingly.
 * [Configure Jira application options|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-jira-application-options/]
  

|User email visibility|Controls how users' email addresses are displayed in the user profile page.
  -*PUBLIC*-  email addresses are visible to all.
  -*HIDDEN*-  email addresses are hidden from all users.
  -*MASKED*-  the email address is masked (for example, 'user@example.com' is displayed as 'user at example dot com').
  -*LOGGED IN USERS ONLY*-  only users logged in to Jira can view the email addresses.
 _Default: *PUBLIC*_|

h3. Actual Results

The public setting won’t override the privacy settings of individuals if they set their email as private. This is due to introduction of GDRP.


h3. Workaround

This settings does not do anything it should be removed.
fields.summary: User email Visibility in the General configuration is kind of obsolete since the GDRP introduction.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Lately, the new issue view is enabled in most Jira components. If there's any old issue view (the wiki renderer), it's confusing to users.

 !Screen Shot 2021-08-27 at 15.56.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Turn on the new issue view to any long text field, including the *Create* issue modal via the top navbar.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Enable the new issue view on the global Create issue modal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Last Activity/Seen not populated even if the user has logged in and commented on a Jira Business project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user and give access only to a Business project.
 # Add a comment or create an issue.
 # Check the Last Activity

h3. Expected Results
Last Seen should be populated under the Admin console *Users* tab

h3. Actual Results
Last Seen is not populated

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Last Seen not populating

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user tries to add either "Days remaining in sprint" or "Sprint health" to their Dashboard, there is no way to Search for an existing Board. (Note: both Search and ABC sorting are available for Projects). 

Searching for an appropriate Board is very time-consuming in larger orgs, or orgs with multiple Boards. Scrolling takes time, and Cmd+F does not work (it closes the widget Configuration).

Because these options are not available, our Customers are impacted (per the Company values).

Additionally, the Sprint Health Gadget is heavily promoted in Atlassian blogs, i.e. here: [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/7-steps-to-a-beautiful-and-useful-agile-dashboard] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Dashboards --> add a widget --> Days remaining in sprint
 # Look for your Board, or click "Configure" to modify already-existing gadget
 # Board search or ABC sorting is not available, so you have to scroll through the entire list
 # Repeat the same for the Sprint health gadget to validate

h3. Expected Results 

User should be able to search Boards in all widgets, or at least see the existing boards sorted alphabetically. The ABC sorting is MVP.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
There is no Search or ABC sorting available for Boards.{noformat}
h3. Workaround
{noformat}
User has to scroll through the entire list of Boards.
{noformat}
h3.
fields.summary: Gadgets "Days remaining in sprint" and "Sprint health" are missing both the Search function and Alphabetical sorting

fields.description: User would like to be able to hide the buttons to open issue search results in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets.
fields.summary: Ability to hide the option Open in Microsoft Excel/Google sheets in advanced search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening Screenshots from installed addons in the Manage apps section they do not open.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Apps > Manage apps
 # Open any installed addon
 # Click on Screenshots if it contains any

h3. Expected Results

A screenshot should open.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, the screenshots preview does nothing when clicked.
h3. Workaround

Access the screenshot by clicking on the Marketplace listing.


 !Screen Shot 2021-08-26 at 15.36.33-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Screenshots cannot be open from Manage apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Slack ID in the Atlassian Profile details

Current features of automatic notification from Jira to Slack:
 1) Send JIra notifications to Slack channel
 2) Sending JIra notifications personally to the user, but then you need to explicitly specify the SlackID in the automation rule and the rule becomes static.

But if the SlackID is explicitly specified in the Jira profile, then it can be dynamically pulled into the automation rule (for example, through the {{assignee.SlackID}} smart variables) -> notifications will be flexibly sent to the right users in Slask -> Users will notice much earlier that from them some action is required on the task
fields.summary: Add SlackID to Jira profile

fields.description:
Dear.

There are needless and redundant .png attachments in a Jira issue, that are added as a side effect when a user replies to a Jira issue message from outlook.

the names are:

image001.png

image002.png

etc...
fields.summary: Prevent needless .png attachments in Jira issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issue's link issue "Search for issues" and Jira search bar yield different results.
Inconsistency is causing users to use Jira search to look up for the issue key and pasting it to the "Search for issues" search bar when trying to link issues.

 Link issue's "Search for issues" cannot find the issue:
 !image-2021-08-26-10-52-00-709.png|width=360!

Jira search can find the issue:
 !image-2021-08-26-10-52-41-757.png|width=360!

h3. Suggested Solution
Make search consistent by incorporating Jira search to the "Search for issues" search bar in Issue view.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issue's link issue "Search for issues" and Jira search bar yields different results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you set the value of a *Date picker field* (date only, without time) by using a *post-function with %%CURRENT_DATETIME%%'* issues where the value is *the last day of a month* will count as the upcoming month in the search


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Oddly, this can only be reproducible on a last day of a month, i.e: July,31st. In that day:
# Run a transition containing a Post-function with %%CURRENT_DATETIME%% to set the value of a date picker
# Run a search as the following
{code} [date picker field name] <= endOfMonth() {code}



h3. Expected Results
The issue appears in the search

h3. Actual Results
The search doesn't find the issue, even though it still has the correct value. 

h3. Workaround
Manually update the field to the same day
fields.summary: Post-functions using '%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%' on a Date Picker field hides issues from the endOfMonth() search function when set to the last day of month.
